page.title: 10Local History,Kinross Area
page.content: Much of the history of the county of Kinross has strong links with present day work and industry.One of the main sources of income in the town is tourism,especially to the following places.{Loch Leven Castle}which stands on Castle Island is 12th Century and may be visited by boat from May to September.Mary Queen of Scots was imprisoned there in 1568.{Kinross {House}was built around 1680 by Sir William Bruce and is now the property of local landowner,Sir David Montgomery.The house is not open to the public but the gardens can be visited in the afternoons from May to September.Both the castle and the house lie just outside the sample area.{Coaching Inns},which are the Green Hotel,The Kirklands and The Salutation,were originally built on the road from Edinburgh to Perth.
